results.title: Radiation
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From a sun-drenched bathing beach to an awesome “gamma garden,” this film explores how heat, radio waves, x-rays and gamma rays affect various forms of life. It takes you to the radiological department of a modern hospital, to Canada’s atomic research center at Chalk River, and to the Brookhaven National Laboratory in the United States, where plant growth is subjected to gamma radiation.

results.title: Radiant energy and the electromagnetic spectrum
results.brief_description: Re-enacted experiments of discovery and modern sensing devices introduce us to the various forms of radiant energy, giving insights into concepts of waves, wave-lengths and energy.

results.title: Radiance (A)
results.creator_credit: Rachel Perkins, Andrew Myer, Ned Lander and Eclipse Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Three sisters are reunited after the death of their mother; their lifestyles a world apart from each other. Eldest sister Cressy (Rachael Maza), has found success as a classical singer and rejected her past life to pursue a career overseas. Middle daughter Mae (Trisha Morton-Thomas) resents Cressy’s success and feels bitter at being the one whose had to stay behind to care for their senile mother. Youngest sister Nona (Deborah Mailman), is vibrant, sexually promiscuous, pregnant, and unlike her sisters, loyal to the memory of their mother. In the brief time the sisters spend together, they learn the painful memories and secrets that has distanced them from one another, and as the family’s intrigue is revealed the sisters can finally unite together.

results.title: Radiance
results.brief_description: With the death of their mother, two sisters (Nona and Cressy) return to their childhood home in Northern Australia where their third sister, Mae, lived looking after their mother. The funeral happens and the three find themselves together in the house for the first time in years. With time to talk, drink and fight, past hurts are revealed and family secrets come out.

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

constellations_other.name: Connecting through film
constellations_other.description: Film acts like a time capsule to our collective past. Capturing our most treasured moments with family has never been more accessible, with technology right at our fingers.

results.title: Radha and Krishna (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Among India’s legends one of the most poetic is the story of Radha and Krishna. Artists through the centuries have used this legend and the film brings to life the allegory in a series of miniature paintings.

results.title: Rad Racer
results.brief_description: This is no ordinary game pak. This is Rad Racer. Nintendo’s thrilling 3-D video game Rad Racer comes action-packed with revolutionary 3-D technology and 3-D glasses (they’re free inside) that will have you really believing you’re in the middle of a cross-country rally race - cruising along at 200 miles per hour! Rad Racer takes you through 8 treacherous race courses including the Los Angeles Nightway, the San Francisco Highway and the Grand Canyon. Choose the Ferrari and you’ll enter a Super Machine competition where you’ll race against Corvettes and Lamborghinis. Select the F-1 Machine and you’ll compete against incredibly fast cars. Whether it’s Ferrari or F-1, 3-D or regular mode, Rad Racer’s hairpin curves, daredevil turns and realistic action will bring home all the fun and excitement of real rally racing. Think you’re up to it? Then drivers, start your engines. It’s Rad Racer!

constellations_other.name: Love of the Glove
constellations_other.description: Looking at the Powerglove's influence on film and television.

results.title: Racoons picnic
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: The adventures of two young raccoons during a daylight safari in search of food. Beatrice and Willie set off through the woods and on reaching a lake, discover lunches left by two boys swimming. The boys discover the scavengers, the scavengers discover the angry boys and scamper off back to the safety of the woods.

results.title: Racing silver: German Motorracing 1900-1971
results.creator_credit: Michael J. Churchill, Neville Hay and Duke Marketing
results.brief_description: Motoring authority Neville Hay takes a fascinating journey through the archives of Mercedes Benz and Auto Union from 1900 to the late 1960s. We also take a look at Porsche and BMW as he sheds light on the innovative design, construction and magnificent drivers (such as Fangio, Moss, Caracciola, Lang and Nuvolari) which brought these manufacturers extraordinary success in Grand Prix and sports car racing during those years.

results.title: Racing red: great Italian racing cars
results.brief_description: From the beginnings of racing the Italians have been passionately involved with designing, building and racing motor cars in their national racing colour of brilliant red. Famous car makes such as Fiat, Alfa Romeo, Maserati, Lancia and Ferrari all illustrate the appeal of these exotic machines, from the era before cars were covered in commercial sponsorship. Rare archival footage from the start of the century until the mid-70’s complements modern day footage, and automobile authority Neville Hay provides commentary and anecdotes from his vast experience in motor racing.
